Art. 4.81. 
Assignment of rights of succession 
A person who sells his rights of succession without specifying in detail the property making up the succession is only required to guarantee his status as heir.
If he has already benefited from the fruits of any property, or received the amount of any claim belonging to the succession, or sold any property of the succession, he is bound to repay them to the purchaser, unless he has expressly reserved them at the time of the sale.
The purchaser, for his part, must reimburse the seller for what the latter has paid for the debts and charges of the estate, and pay him everything of which he was a creditor, unless otherwise stipulated.
